textBeforeTable: Degrees Conferred (July 1, 2013 - June 30, 2014) Go to Top ACT: 31-35 SAT-Writing: 710-790 SAT-Math: 700-800 SAT-Verbal: 710-800 Test score ranges (25th to 75th percentiles) for enrolled freshmen: 11% of matriculants are international students. 12% of matriculants were children of Yale alumni. 43% of maticulants came from independent, parochial, and other schools. 57% of matriculants came from public high schools. Yield: 71.5% # of Matriculants: 1,360 % Accepted: 6.3% # of Applicants: 30,932 Acceptance Statistics: Statistics on Current 2014-15 Freshmen Class Click here to view more information and statistics on study abroad students. 87% of undergraduates live in University housing. 98% of Freshmen return for their sophomore year. 96% graduate within five years; 98% graduate within six years. 94% are from out-of-state (including nonresident aliens). The average age of an undergraduate is 20. 915 students (regular and summer term) studied abroad in 2013-14. Yale College Student Body Characteristics *International excludes U.S. citizens and students who have permanent resident status. China, Canada, Germany, India, South Korea, and the United Kingdom Top 5 countries 117 Numbers of countries represented 19% Percentage who are international students* International Student Profile International Students Go to Top  *Students self-reporting two or more races are counted once
textAfterTable: Go to Top Yale College Post-Graduate Plans - Class of 2014 When asked about their expected plans for the fall following graduation almost three-quarters (74.2%) of respondents intend to be working, with the next largest group (17.0%) planning to attend graduate school. Those not attending graduate school immediately were asked if they intend to enroll in a graduate program within the next five years. 82.2% indicated they intend to pursue graduate school within the next five years. Expected Plans for Fall 2014:   Working for pay full-time/part-time/short-term position 74.2%           Attending graduate or professional school 17.0% Independent Research (including scholarships/fellowships     such as Rhodes and Fulbright 4.3% Traveling 2.4% Volunteer activity (not for pay) 1.6% Family and other caregiving 0.4% Military service 0.1%   To view the full report please visit the Yale Office of Career Strategy Go to Top University Alumni Donors Academic Year Number of Solicited Alumni Number of Alumni Donors % Participation 1995-96 109,961 50,792 46% 1996-97 111,506 52,849 47% 1997-98 112,247 51,382 46% 1998-99 114,642
